Generation I.Red: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
Generation I.Yellow: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is melted in a day, bones and all.
Generation I.Stadium: Attracts prey with sweet-smelling honey. Its prey include bugs, naturally, and even large animals on occasion.

Generation II.Gold: Acid that has dissolved many prey becomes sweeter, making it even more effective at attracting prey.
Generation II.Silver: This horrifying plant Pok é mon attracts prey with aromatic honey, then melts them in its mouth.
Generation II.Crystal: Once ingested into this Pok é mon 's body, even the hardest object will melt into nothing.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Acid that has dissolved many prey becomes sweeter, making it even more effective at attracting prey. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) This horrifying plant Pok é mon attracts prey with aromatic honey, then melts them in its mouth. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pok é mon swallows it whole.
Generation III.Sapphire: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pok é mon swallows it whole.
Generation III.Emerald: The long vine extending from its head is waved about as if it were a living thing to attract prey. When an unsuspecting victim approaches, it is swallowed whole.
Generation III.FireRed: Lures prey into its mouth with a honeylike aroma. The helpless prey is melted with a dissolving fluid.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
